sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Tecumseh Sulako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At least 18 people have been killed by a Russian missile attack on a residential apartment block close to the Ukrainian Black Sea port city of Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The EU Commission president urges Ukraine to speed up reforms if it wants more support for its bid to become an EU member.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine to speed up reforms if it wants more support for its bid to become an EU member.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And riders ready, pedals ready, as the Tour de France's departure begins in Denmark, we'll look at who's favourite to win the world's most famous cycle race.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In yet another attack on a residential building, at least 21 people were killed, this time in the Odessa region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the now all too familiar site, rescuers pulled those lucky enough to survive from the ruins, where Lai destroyed lives and hopes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Kyiv claims it's the revenge of Russian troops who left the strategic Snake Island in the Black Sea after coming under sustained bombardment from Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But Moscow has said, as they have said before, that the Ukrainian narrative is false.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Russian presidential spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Russian Federation armed forces do not target civilian objects and civilian infrastructure sites in the course of the special military operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Peskov also added that Russia does target munition warehouses and places where they accuse Ukraine of training mercenaries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And in Lysyshanks, in Donbass, the fighting is intensifying around the city's refinery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There's been no running water or electricity here for weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Slowly these people are suffering the same fate as those of Mariupol and Sviadunetsk before them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This family has decided not to leave and suffered weeks of bombing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Alyona's husband was killed in one of the raids.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He was buried in the courtyard of their house.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There are neighbors here who don't want to leave, but she can't stand it any longer. Just days after Ukraine gained EU candidacy status, the European Commission president

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: has urged the country to accelerate reforms needed to attain full membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ursula von der Leyen was speaking in a special address to the Ukrainian parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Amid fears of weakening EU support, she also offered reassurance. Putin's army is still killing your brothers and sisters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They continue occupying your land, stealing your grain and bombing your cities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: You are fighting back bravely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And Europe will stand up with Ukraine as long as it takes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We will not rest until you prevail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It will take years for Ukraine to become an EU member, and Brussels requires Kyiv to undertake a raft of anti-corruption reforms before it can happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Preventing and combating corruption has been particularly high on your agenda since the revolution of dignity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: You have created an impressive anti-corruption machine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But now these institutions need teeth and the right people in senior posts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Becoming a candidate for EU membership was a huge morale boost for the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: How quickly it achieves that goal is now in its own hands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Discontent is brewing among employees of European airlines and airports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Cancellations and delays plague French airports as workers go on strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They're demanding higher pay against the backdrop of rising inflation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One union member said airport activity reached 95% of its pre-COVID level, except that now we have 20,000 fewer employees at Roissy Airport, so working conditions deteriorated dramatically.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So we find ourselves where we cannot handle the passengers, where colleagues cannot take breaks, which sounds incredible. This is the reason behind the chaos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The protest coincides with the recovery of tourism this summer after two years of travel restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And some passengers do not hide their discomfort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With Covid gaining ground, no, it's not very nice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's not very supportive, shall we say, for people who have a plane to catch and who have made their arrangements for several months. We're kind of being held hostage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The situation is also dire for workers of the low-cost airlines Ryanair and EasyJet in Spain, who are demanding equal pay to their European colleagues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We demand that our salaries be equal to, or at least close to, those of our colleagues in Europe, especially in France, Italy and Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But their European colleagues are not particularly happy with their situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Like in France, unions in Germany are demanding wage increases and more staff to cope with the tsunami of summer holiday flights. Delays are frequent and some passengers are even arriving a day in advance to make sure they won't miss their flights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Inflation across the Eurozone area rose to 8.6% in June, a new record since record-keeping began 25 years ago in 1997.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Belgium, Portugal, Ireland and the Netherlands all logged rates as high as 10%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Spain's inflation grew by 10.2%, its highest in 37 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The main drivers of this increase is undoubtedly caused by energy prices sparked by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Energy prices estimated to have risen on an annual basis of 41.9%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Food prices are estimated to have risen by 8.9%, up from 7.5% in May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The services industry has also made a marked contribution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: According to analysts, June inflation would have been higher if Germany did not introduce temporary relief measures on fuel and transport, supporting arguments that further price pressures are still in the pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Malta had Europe's lowest inflation rate in June, standing at 6.1%. Gay and lesbian couples in Switzerland can now officially tie the knot, as a new law

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: on same-sex marriage came into force on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Euronews spoke to one Swiss couple who are looking forward to their special day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We feel very emotional, actually.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: I mean, we have waited such a long time to be finally equally allowed to marry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's incredible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For me, it's just equality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It means that we are treated equally, that we are the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And it's a powerful, powerful day. And I'm really, really happy that I can be here and actually get married to this woman.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Alpine nation approved same-sex civil partnerships in 2007.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: in 2007. But this step follows a nationwide referendum held last year, in which over 64% of voters backed the Marriage for All bill.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Thousands of Sudanese protesters are taking part in mass rallies in the capital Khartoum

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: to demand an end to military rule.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At least seven demonstrators were killed in one of the most violent days this year as part of the security forces' ongoing crackdown on the anti-coup movement in Sudan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A new Barbie for an old legend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Signature Collection have released a limited edition doll of David Bowie and no details been spared, from the platform shoes to his iconic red mullet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The retro doll's a celebration of Hunky Dory's 50th anniversary, the artist's fifth album.
